p: Intratumor administration of a plasmid carrying the apoptin gene with PolyI:PolyC not only significantly inhibited the growth of the 4T1 mammary tumor in Balb/c mice, but also induced a potent antitumor immune response, as evidenced by an increase in the number of CD4+ and CD8+ T-lymphocytes, increased secretion of cytokines into the circulation (IFN-Î³, IL-2) and tumor tissue infiltration with immune cells [ 117, 118]. Similar data were obtained using PolyI:PolyC together with the canine parvovirus NS1 (CPV2.NS1) protein [ 117, 118].
